abstract: There was time, not that long ago, when private equity firms did not even consider technology companies as potential buyout candidates. Tech companies often have unpredictable cash flows, making it difficult to cover the interest payments in a debt-funded takeover. They can also require huge capital expenditures, which means more investment front and lower returns down the line. Things have changed, however — consider last year’s hotly contested $18.8 billion deal for Freescale Semiconductor — so analysts at Citigroup took a look at which tech companies might draw buyout interest.
